title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Corinthians chapter 14 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Corinthians Chapter 14.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 14:1, what should believers desire?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:1 instructs believers to desire spiritual gifts and to follow charity.

questions.question: Who does one speak to when speaking in an unknown tongue, according to 1 Corinthians 14:2?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:2 says that when one speaks in an unknown tongue, they speak unto God, not men.

questions.question: What does he that prophesieth speak unto men for, as stated in 1 Corinthians 14:3?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:3 explains that prophecy speaks to men for edification, exhortation, and comfort.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 14:4, who does the one speaking in tongues edify?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:4 states that the one speaking in tongues edifies himself.

questions.question: Which is greater according to 1 Corinthians 14:5?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:5 says that prophecy is greater than speaking in tongues unless the tongues are interpreted.

questions.question: What is the benefit of speaking in tongues without interpretation, as suggested in 1 Corinthians 14:6?
options: It brings joy to the church
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:6 explains that speaking in tongues without revelation, knowledge, prophecy, or doctrine profits nothing.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 14:8, what happens if the trumpet gives an uncertain sound?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:8 uses the example of a trumpet giving an uncertain sound causing no one to prepare for battle.

questions.question: What must one who speaks in an unknown tongue do according to 1 Corinthians 14:13?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:13 instructs those who speak in an unknown tongue to pray that they may interpret.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 14:18, Paul thanks God because he speaks with tongues more than whom?
questions.explanation: Paul states in 1 Corinthians 14:18 that he speaks with tongues more than all the Corinthians.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 14:20, in what should believers be mature?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:20 encourages believers to be mature in understanding but children in malice.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 14:22, tongues are a sign for those who believe.
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:22 states tongues are a sign not to those who believe, but to those who believe not.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Corinthians 14:33 teaches that God is the author of confusion.
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:33 says that God is not the author of confusion but of peace.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 14:39, believers should forbid speaking with tongues.
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:39 encourages believers to covet to prophesy and not forbid speaking with tongues.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 1 Corinthians 14:26: 'When you come together, everyone has a _______, a doctrine, a tongue, a revelation, an interpretation.'
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:26 states that when the church comes together, everyone has a psalm, doctrine, tongue, revelation, or interpretation.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 1 Corinthians 14:40: 'Let all things be done ______ and in order.'
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:40 instructs that all things should be done decently and in order.

medium.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is confused about the purpose of speaking in tongues. Based on 1 Corinthians 14, what biblical truth would you share about the role of tongues?
options: Tongues are a sign for unbelievers, but prophecy edifies believers
Tongues are more important than prophecy in the church
Speaking in tongues always builds up the entire church
Tongues should be spoken loudly and without interpretation
questions.correctAnswer: Tongues are a sign for unbelievers, but prophecy edifies believers
questions.explanation: According to 1 Corinthians 14:22, tongues serve as a sign to unbelievers, while prophecy is for the edification of believers. Verses 4 and 5 also explain that prophecy builds up the church, unlike speaking in tongues unless interpreted.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 14 teach us about the importance of clarity when sharing God's Word in a church setting?
options: Words must be easy to understand so the message is clear
Using complicated language shows spiritual maturity
Speaking loudly is more important than understanding
Silence is preferred over speaking in the church
questions.correctAnswer: Words must be easy to understand so the message is clear
questions.explanation: Verse 9 emphasizes that if words are not understandable, the message will be lost, just as an uncertain trumpet sound fails to prepare for battle (v8). This teaches the importance of clear communication for edification.

questions.question: A believer wants to grow in spiritual gifts. According to 1 Corinthians 14, what should they especially desire and pursue?
options: To prophesy for the edification of the church
To speak in many unknown tongues
To show off spiritual gifts publicly
questions.correctAnswer: To prophesy for the edification of the church
questions.explanation: Verse 1 encourages believers to desire spiritual gifts, especially prophecy, because it builds up, encourages, and comforts the church (v3). This shows the priority of gifts that edify others.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 14 instruct believers to handle speaking in unknown tongues during church gatherings?
options: Only two or three should speak in tongues, and one must interpret
Everyone should speak in tongues at once without interpretation
Speaking in tongues is forbidden in the church
Tongues should be spoken loudly and frequently
questions.correctAnswer: Only two or three should speak in tongues, and one must interpret
questions.explanation: Verse 27 instructs that if anyone speaks in tongues, it should be by two or three at most, and each should speak in turn with interpretation. This ensures order and understanding.

questions.question: What counsel does 1 Corinthians 14 offer regarding praying in an unknown tongue without understanding?
options: Pray that you may interpret what you say
Pray silently without concern for understanding
questions.correctAnswer: Pray that you may interpret what you say
questions.explanation: Verse 13 advises that anyone speaking in an unknown tongue should pray to interpret so that the church may be edified. This highlights the importance of understanding in prayer.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 14 guide the behavior of women in church meetings regarding speaking?
options: Women should keep silent and learn at home from their husbands
Women should lead the church's teaching
Women may speak freely during the service
questions.correctAnswer: Women should keep silent and learn at home from their husbands
questions.explanation: Verses 34 and 35 instruct women to keep silent in churches and, if they want to learn, to ask their husbands at home. This emphasizes order and respect for church roles.

questions.question: A church member is eager to prophesy but unsure about judging prophecy. What does 1 Corinthians 14 teach about judging prophetic messages?
options: Other prophets should judge the prophecies
Everyone must accept all prophecies without question
Only the church leader should judge prophecy
questions.correctAnswer: Other prophets should judge the prophecies
questions.explanation: Verse 29 states that two or three prophets should speak, and the others should judge. This ensures accountability and discernment in prophecy.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 14, God is the author of confusion in the church.
questions.explanation: Verse 33 clearly states that God is not the author of confusion but of peace in the churches of the saints, teaching the importance of orderliness.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Corinthians 14 encourages believers to covet to prophesy and forbids speaking in tongues.
questions.explanation: Verse 39 advises believers to desire prophecy and not to forbid speaking in tongues, promoting both gifts when used properly.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to 1 Corinthians 14, when the whole church comes together, everyone may have a _______, doctrine, tongue, revelation, or interpretation, but all things must be done unto _______.
questions.explanation: Verse 26 describes that when the church gathers, each may bring a psalm, doctrine, tongue, revelation, or interpretation, and all must be done for edifying the church.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 14 advise believers to balance praying and singing with spirit and understanding?
options: Pray and sing with both spirit and understanding for fruitfulness
Pray only with the spirit and sing only with understanding
Pray and sing only with the spirit, ignoring understanding
Pray and sing only with understanding, not spirit
questions.correctAnswer: Pray and sing with both spirit and understanding for fruitfulness
questions.explanation: Verse 15 teaches that praying and singing should be done with both spirit and understanding to be fruitful and meaningful.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 14 suggest about the value of speaking a few understandable words in the church compared to many words in an unknown tongue?
options: Speaking five words with understanding is better than ten thousand words in an unknown tongue
Speaking many unknown words is always more valuable
Understanding is not necessary when speaking in tongues
Quantity of words is more important than clarity
questions.correctAnswer: Speaking five words with understanding is better than ten thousand words in an unknown tongue
questions.explanation: Verse 19 explains Paul would rather speak five understandable words to teach others than many words in an unknown tongue, emphasizing clarity over quantity.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 14 teach believers to seek spiritual gifts in relation to the church community?
options: Seek to excel to the edifying of the church
Seek gifts only for personal benefit
Seek gifts to gain status in the church
questions.correctAnswer: Seek to excel to the edifying of the church
questions.explanation: Verse 12 encourages believers to be zealous for spiritual gifts but to seek them in a way that builds up the church community.

questions.question: A visitor who does not believe enters a church where everyone is speaking in tongues. Based on 1 Corinthians 14, what might their reaction be?
options: They may think the believers are mad
They will immediately believe and be converted
They will understand the message clearly
questions.correctAnswer: They may think the believers are mad
questions.explanation: Verse 23 warns that if everyone speaks in tongues in one place, unbelievers or unlearned people might think the church members are mad due to lack of understanding.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 14 say about how prophecy affects an unbeliever who enters the church?
options: They are convicted, judged, and recognize God is truly among the believers
They ignore the prophecy and leave
They become silent and do not respond
questions.correctAnswer: They are convicted, judged, and recognize God is truly among the believers
questions.explanation: Verses 24-25 describe that when an unbeliever hears prophecy, they are convinced and judged by all, their heart's secrets are revealed, and they worship God acknowledging His presence.

hard.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Corinthians Chapter 14.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 14:1, what should believers desire more than other spiritual gifts?
questions.explanation: Verse 1 exhorts believers to desire spiritual gifts but especially to prophesy, highlighting the priority of prophecy over other gifts.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 14:2, speaking in an unknown tongue is described as speaking unto whom?
questions.explanation: Verse 2 explains that speaking in unknown tongues is speaking not to men but to God, since no man understands the speaker.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of prophecy as described in 1 Corinthians 14:3?
questions.explanation: The verse directly states that prophecy is for the building up (edification), encouragement (exhortation), and consolation (comfort) of believers.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 1 Corinthians 14:4: 'He that speaketh in an unknown tongue edifieth _______; but he that prophesieth edifieth the church.'
questions.explanation: The verse contrasts speaking in tongues, which edifies the individual, with prophecy, which edifies the entire church.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 14:5, why is prophecy considered greater than speaking in tongues?
options: Because it edifies the church unless tongues are interpreted
Because it is a sign to unbelievers
Because it is a gift from the apostles
questions.correctAnswer: Because it edifies the church unless tongues are interpreted
questions.explanation: Verse 5 states prophecy is greater unless tongues are interpreted, so the church is edified and understands.

questions.question: In the analogy of musical instruments (1 Corinthians 14:7-8), what does an uncertain sound from the trumpet symbolize in the context of spiritual gifts?
questions.explanation: Verse 8 uses the trumpet's uncertain sound as a symbol for unclear speech, which fails to prepare for battle, thus representing confusion.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 14:9, speaking in tongues without clear words is likened to speaking into the air.
questions.explanation: Verse 9 explicitly states that unless words are easy to understand, it is as if one speaks into the air, emphasizing the need for clarity.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 14:11, Paul uses the term 'barbarian' to illustrate what concept regarding unknown tongues?
questions.explanation: Verse 11 explains that if one does not understand the meaning, both speaker and listener become like barbarians to each other, symbolizing lack of communication.

questions.question: What practice does Paul recommend in 1 Corinthians 14:13 for those who speak in unknown tongues?
options: Pray for the ability to interpret
Teach others to speak in tongues
questions.correctAnswer: Pray for the ability to interpret
questions.explanation: Verse 13 instructs that one who speaks in unknown tongues should pray to interpret so the church may be edified.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 14:15, how does Paul describe the ideal way to pray and sing?
questions.explanation: Verse 15 expresses Paul's desire to pray and sing not only with the spirit but also with the understanding, emphasizing balance.

questions.question: In the cultural context of 1 Corinthians 14:34-35, why are women instructed to keep silence in the churches?
options: Because it was considered shameful for them to speak publicly
Because the law forbade women to attend church
questions.correctAnswer: Because it was considered shameful for them to speak publicly
questions.explanation: Verses 34-35 reflect the first-century cultural and legal norms where public speech by women was seen as shameful and they were to learn in submission at home.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 14:22 say about the function of tongues as a sign?
options: Tongues are a sign to unbelievers, not believers
Tongues are a sign to believers only
Tongues are a sign of holiness
Tongues are a sign of apostolic authority
questions.correctAnswer: Tongues are a sign to unbelievers, not believers
questions.explanation: Verse 22 describes tongues as a sign for those who do not believe, contrasting with prophecy which serves believers.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 14:24-25 describe the effect of prophecy on an unbeliever or unlearned person entering the church?
options: They are convicted, judged, and recognize God's presence
questions.correctAnswer: They are convicted, judged, and recognize God's presence
questions.explanation: The passage explains that prophecy convinces the unbeliever of sin, reveals their heart, and leads them to worship God acknowledging His presence.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 14:32, what is said about the spirits of prophets?
options: They are subject to the prophets themselves
questions.correctAnswer: They are subject to the prophets themselves
questions.explanation: Verse 32 emphasizes the self-control and discernment of prophets over their spirits during prophecy.

questions.question: What is the main principle Paul insists on in 1 Corinthians 14:40 regarding worship and church gatherings?
options: All things must be done decently and in order
questions.correctAnswer: All things must be done decently and in order
questions.explanation: Verse 40 concludes the chapter by commanding that everything in church be conducted in an orderly and proper manner to avoid confusion.

theological.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Corinthians Chapter 14 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 14, which spiritual gift should believers desire above all?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:1 encourages believers to desire spiritual gifts, especially that they may prophesy, because prophecy edifies the church (verse 4). This aligns with Old Testament emphasis on prophecy as a means of God revealing His word (Joel 2:28; Amos 3:7).

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of speaking in an unknown tongue, according to 1 Corinthians 14?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:2 states that speaking in tongues is speaking not to men but to God, revealing mysteries in the Spirit. This spiritual communication is inward and not understood by others, highlighting the distinction between tongues and prophecy (Acts 2:4; Mark 16:17).

questions.question: Why does Paul say prophecy is greater than speaking with tongues unless interpretation is given?
options: Because prophecy brings edification to the church
Because tongues are a sign only for unbelievers
questions.correctAnswer: Because prophecy brings edification to the church
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:5 teaches that prophecy is greater than tongues unless the tongues are interpreted, so the church may be edified. Prophecy builds up, encourages, and comforts the congregation (verse 3), corresponding to God's design for the church body (Ephesians 4:11-12).

questions.question: What analogy does Paul use to explain the necessity of clear communication in the church?
questions.explanation: In 1 Corinthians 14:7, Paul compares communication to musical instruments which must produce distinct sounds to be understood. This analogy underscores the need for intelligibility in worship, consistent with God’s orderliness (1 Corinthians 14:33) and the biblical principle of clarity in teaching (Deuteronomy 31:12).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'For God is not the author of _______, but of peace, as in all churches of the saints.'
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:33 states that God is not the author of confusion but of peace, emphasizing divine order in worship and church life. This principle aligns with the peace God desires in the community (Romans 14:17; Psalm 29:11).

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 14, what should one who speaks in an unknown tongue do?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:13 instructs that anyone speaking in tongues should pray for the gift of interpretation so that the church can be edified. This emphasizes the corporate nature of worship and aligns with the goal of building up the body of Christ (Ephesians 4:16).

questions.question: What does Paul say about praying or singing with the spirit without understanding?
options: It is acceptable and spiritually fruitful
The spirit prays but the understanding is unfruitful
It should be done only in private
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit prays but the understanding is unfruitful
questions.explanation: In 1 Corinthians 14:14, Paul explains that praying in an unknown tongue is the spirit praying, but the mind remains unfruitful. This highlights the need for understanding in worship, consistent with biblical teaching on worship in spirit and truth (John 4:24).

questions.question: Why does Paul prefer to speak five words with his understanding rather than ten thousand in an unknown tongue in the church?
options: Because speaking many words is prideful
Because tongues are not a gift for all
Because fewer words are more powerful
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:19 emphasizes that speaking intelligibly in church benefits others through teaching. This reflects the biblical priority of edifying the body by clear communication (Colossians 3:16) and aligns with the priestly role of teaching God’s word (1 Peter 2:9).

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 14 say about the role of tongues as a sign?
options: Tongues are a sign for unbelievers
Tongues are a sign for believers
Tongues are a sign of spiritual maturity
Tongues are a sign of prophecy
questions.correctAnswer: Tongues are a sign for unbelievers
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:22 notes tongues serve as a sign not to believers but to unbelievers, whereas prophecy serves believers. This is consistent with tongues at Pentecost as a sign to outsiders (Acts 2:6-11) and the biblical use of signs to confirm God’s revelation (Exodus 4:8).

questions.question: How should the church conduct speaking in tongues during gatherings, according to Paul?
options: Only two or three should speak, each in turn, with an interpreter
Everyone should speak freely without order
Only one person should speak at a time, with no interpreter
Speaking in tongues should be forbidden
questions.correctAnswer: Only two or three should speak, each in turn, with an interpreter
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:27 instructs that speaking in tongues should be limited to two or three persons, speaking one at a time, and only with an interpreter. This promotes order and edification consistent with God’s nature as author of peace, not confusion (1 Corinthians 14:33).

questions.question: What should happen if there is no interpreter when someone speaks in tongues in the church?
options: The speaker should remain silent in the church
The congregation should guess the meaning
questions.correctAnswer: The speaker should remain silent in the church
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:28 commands that without an interpreter, the speaker must keep silent in the church and speak only to himself and God. This maintains order and ensures that worship is edifying to all, reflecting biblical norms for orderly worship (Deuteronomy 31:12; Acts 2:42).

questions.question: Who does Paul say should judge the prophets when they speak in the church?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:29 states that when prophets speak, two or three should do so, and the others should judge. This indicates a mutual accountability among spiritual leaders, consistent with biblical patterns of prophetic accountability (Deuteronomy 13:1-5; 1 Thessalonians 5:20-21).

questions.question: What does Paul say about the spirits of the prophets in 1 Corinthians 14?
options: They are subject to the prophets
questions.correctAnswer: They are subject to the prophets
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:32 states that the spirits of prophets are subject to them, indicating that prophets exercise self-control and order in their ministry. This aligns with the biblical emphasis on self-discipline and submission to God’s authority (2 Timothy 1:7; 1 Peter 4:11).

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 14, what should be the attitude of women in the church during public worship?
options: Keep silence and be under obedience
Speak freely as they are led by the Spirit
Teach the men in the church
questions.correctAnswer: Keep silence and be under obedience
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:34-35 instruct women to keep silence in churches and be under obedience, asking their husbands at home if they want to learn. This reflects cultural and ecclesiastical order at that time, consistent with Old Testament practices of orderly worship (Leviticus 10:1-3) and the complementarity reflected in Scripture (Ephesians 5:22-24).

questions.question: What command does Paul give about all things in the church gatherings in 1 Corinthians 14?
options: Let all things be done decently and in order
Let everyone speak as they feel led
Let the most gifted speak the most
Let the elders control all speech
questions.correctAnswer: Let all things be done decently and in order
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 14:40 concludes with the principle that all things in church should be done decently and in order, reflecting God’s nature and the need for peace and edification in worship. This principle is consistent with the orderly worship prescribed throughout Scripture (Exodus 25:9; 1 Timothy 2:2).
